definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: The direct calculation method of precision conversion of long range antiship missile is discussed.

sentences.english: What do you mean, you counted it?
To those I recommend using the Deathday Cake dating.
sentences.chinese: 對於那些人，我推薦用忌辰蛋糕來推算年份。

sentences.english: On the other hand, to utilize wind field data to calculate wind-wave, then to confirm the wave factors of deep waters indirectly.
sentences.chinese: 二是利用風場資料間接推算風浪場來確定深水波要素。

sentences.english: It's a very interesting little process.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很有趣的推算過程。

sentences.english: They projected costs and energy consumption two years out for each option.

sentences.english: If you imagined--;So, here is his calculations.

sentences.english: The time when a solar eclipse will occur can be calculated.

sentences.english: Indirect Estimation is made to the value-added of self-employed according to the tax data and the number of individual business.

sentences.english: Densitometry was used to calculate peak particle diameters.
sentences.chinese: 使用密度計去推算粒孚的最大直徑。

sentences.english: Settle the toll rate and charge standard with the unification of vehicle classification.

sentences.english: The ebb was to fall early in the morning.

sentences.english: The warranty period starts form the invoice date. If the customer loses the invoice, it starts from the manufacturing date.
sentences.chinese: 用戶遺失購買發票時，應按出廠日期推算三包有效期。

sentences.english: Demographers have calculated that the world's population will double by the end of the twentieth century.
sentences.chinese: 人口統計學家推算到了二十世紀末世界人口會加倍。

definition: to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
